engradeelnayyar: This room is for Gitter support, not general technical support. Please read and adhere to the welcome message you see when joining rooms and the room description/topic at the top in the chat header. Google will be your best bet to compare options __eou__
Hey would it ever be possible that IRC access could be allowed to not require signup (for non private rooms, perhaps as opt in?) __eou__
like freenode? __eou__
yes __eou__
exactly like freenode __eou__

of course, I do also use freenode, but everyone loves gitter more than freenode. I especially like the public logging of channels Gitter does, which is something that freenode doesn't have or even encourage by default. __eou__
me too - but for something I am working on gitter works better __eou__

I wouldn't mind having some sort of bridge from Gitter to my freenode channel, which I already have public logging for. I would consider my logs to be canonical. I wouldn't care if Gitter logs the channel as well. It's more about having an easy way for people to jump into the channel and start talking. __eou__
We tried same room.io which is close - but makes it come through one user, which is odd. __eou__

Yeah, I haven't quite been satisfied with the user experience so far. For now, I just stook up an instance of Shout so people have an easy way to connect to the freenode channel from a web browser. No freenode captcha, no having to think about which channel to join. You just pick a username and start talking. Works pretty well. __eou__
The user experience of the various "sync freenode and Gitter" solutions, I mean. __eou__
How to make a room invite only afterwards? __eou__
Bluscream: you can't change the room type after you've created it __eou__
So i have to delete and recreate the whole room? :/ __eou__
That's not very user-friendly __eou__
It's just not something that's implemented yet __eou__
I can count on one hand the number of times it's been requested, and i don't have an abnormally large number of fingers ;) __eou__

MadLittleMods: and colleagues, has anyone else reported sporadic search failures? For example, around one minute ago, seekingwebhooksin this room found nothing and there appeared a notification about communication issues. __eou__

A second search for the same word found some matches, and there reappeared the notification. Subsequent searches for the same word found nothing, and there reappeared the notification. For example: __eou__

Has anyone had the issue of all fonts being italic? __eou__
Using Edge __eou__
It only happens on one of my machine __eou__
Clearing cache, signing out etc nothing helped __eou__
Sounds like a font/style override in your browser, all sites or just one? __eou__
Only Gitter __eou__
[<-LINK->]  __eou__
And it started totally out of nowhere __eou__
[<-ISSUE->]  __eou__
that it only happens on one computer and we've heard no other reports of it, would lead me to believe it's something specific with your setup __eou__
does Edge have multiple profiles and does it happen on the same machine in another browser <--- that would actually be interesting, i have a theory __eou__

which is, we use Source Sans font, but we also look for a local version of it before going out to the web for a web font. andmaybeyou have a corrupt local version of source sans on your machine where the regular style is somehow italic __eou__
can you check your installed fonts? __eou__
you can also try inspect and go down to.fonts-loaded bodyclass and removeSourceSansLocal __eou__
felixfbecker:  __eou__
let me check __eou__
it works fine in Chrome __eou__
I heard some other user had the same problem __eou__
Removing SourceSansLocal does not solve it __eou__
try removing any of the other ones one at a time from left to right __eou__
removing source-sans-pro fixes it __eou__
So now it is font-family: Source Sans Pro,-apple-system,Roboto,pt sans,calibri,sans-serif; __eou__
But the font looks different now than in Chrome __eou__
source-sans-prois the web font - so somehow your browser is displaying/loading italic in place of regular __eou__
Okay, so I went to fontsquirrel and installed Source Code Pro __eou__
Now only the chat box is italic, the chat and chat rooms not anymore __eou__
I don't see any network requests for the font __eou__
i can see why, the intput text area for some reason doesn't have the local fall-back font __eou__
But still, there is an issue when the user does not have the font downloaded __eou__
i still don't understand why Edge is displaying italics - doesn't happen on your other machine, same OS/Edge versions? __eou__
hm actually my other machine is on stable, while this one is on Insiders.  __eou__
ut I don't think that is the problem, because it appeared out of nowhere and I was on Insiders before already __eou__
is there a reason the gist preview box doesn't get scrollbars when embedded vs how GitHub's own embed URLs work eg on a blog? __eou__
